item.description:
His last lecture was wonderful, come join us for the next. Lets meet at 3:30 in the gallery and enjoy the current exhibit on diplay. Then we can move on to the lecture hall.


Da Vinci, the first Neuro-Scientist - David Dunlop

Sunday, February 6th, 2011 at 4:30pm

$10 Members, $12 Non-Members

How did Leonardoâ€™s discoveries in the art of painting and the biology of vision predict and alter the future of art? What were his methods and materials? How did later artists adopt his theories on color and perspective and the depiction of light, motion and form? How did he use his scientific observations to re-invent the way we look at and make pictures? What is his influence on artists practicing today? What observations have contemporary artists neglected?

All lectures are held in the School of Art, Sara Victoria Hall Auditorium.

Call the School Office at 203-966-6668 ext. 2 for information
item.how_to_find_us: meet in the gallery at 3:30 if you wish, or at 4:10 in the lecture Hall.
item.name: Da Vinci, the first Neuro-Scientist - David Dunlop
